description: An mplsLspInfoUp trap signifies that the
specified LSP is up. The current active
path for the LSP is mplsPathInfoName.

Summary.eval: ($v2 eq '') ? 'MPLS LSP $v1 is up. Active path: unspecified' : 'MPLS LSP $v1 is up. Active path: $v2'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoUp MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoName.1.1.2 s EXAMPLE MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the Label Switched Path.
variables.name: MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoName

description: The name of the active path for this LSP, if
any. If there is none, the name should be
empty; in that case, the rest of the fields
in mplsLspInfoEntry are meaningless.
variables.name: MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName

description: An mplsLspInfoDown trap signifies that the
specified LSP is down, because the current
active path mplsPathInfoName went down.

Summary.eval: ($v2 eq '') ? 'MPLS LSP $v1 is down. Active path: unspecified' : 'MPLS LSP $v1 is down. Active path: $v2'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoDown MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoName.1.1.2 s EXAMPLE MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the Label Switched Path.
variables.name: MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoName

description: The name of the active path for this LSP, if
any. If there is none, the name should be
empty; in that case, the rest of the fields
in mplsLspInfoEntry are meaningless.
variables.name: MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName

description: An mplsLspInfoChange trap signifies that the
the specified LSP has switched traffic to
the new active path 'toLspPath'. The LSP maintains
up state before and after the switch over

Summary.eval: ($v2 eq '') ? 'MPLS LSP $v1 switched to new active path: unspecified' : 'MPLS LSP $v1 switched to new active path: $v2'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoChange MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoName.1.1.2 s EXAMPLE MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName s EXAMPLE

description: Name of the Label Switched Path.

description: The name of the active path for this LSP, if

empty; in that case, the rest of the fields
in mplsLspInfoEntry are meaningless.
variables.name: MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName

description: An mplsLspInfoPathDown trap signifies that the
specified path mplsPathName for the specified
LSP mplsLspInfoName went down
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoPathDown MPLS-MIB::mplsLspInfoName.1.1.2 s EXAMPLE MPLS-MIB::mplsPathInfoName s EXAMPLE
